Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Tor \Tor\, n. [AS. torr; cf. Gael. torr. Cf. {Tower}.] [1913 Webster] 1. A tower; a turret. [R.] --Ray. [1913 Webster]
2. High-pointed hill; a rocky pinnacle. [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]
A rolling range of dreary moors, unbroken by tor or tree. --C. Kingsley. [1913 Webster]
tor n 1: a prominent rock or pile of rocks on a hill 2: a high rocky hill
